messages.title: David Drew on... education
messages.content: We will build a new National Education Service, open to all throughout their lives. We will create universal public childcare to give all children a good start in life, allowing greater sharing of responsibilities and removing barriers to women participating in the labour market. We will bring about the progressive restoration of free education for all; and guarantee quality apprenticeships and adult skills training.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will build a new National Education Service, open to all throughout their lives.
We will create universal public childcare to give all children a good start in life, allowing greater sharing of responsibilities and removing barriers to women participating in the labour market.
We will bring about the progressive restoration of free education for all.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Quality Apprenticeships and Adult Skills Training
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will guarantee quality apprenticeships and adult skills training.

issues.education: We need to trust our professional teachers to get on with their jobs, and get away from the testing obsessed regime of today. The proposal to test 4 year old children in their first weeks at school, is madness. There is no evidence that the government's obsession with free schools, academies and grammar schools has improved standards. Money wasted on these vanity schemes will go into the education system and make the biggest difference. There is growing evidence, for example, that Sure Start Children's Centres made a massive difference to the children who went to them. This and more will be at the centre of our educational policies.

community.content: Conservative policy is wrecking the education of our young people. Children only have one chance to get a decent education, and the Tories have spent the last seven years tearing our system apart. This year alone sees: - £103,754 average cuts to primary school budgets - £470,433 average cuts to secondary school budgets - a £403 average loss per primary pupil - a £554 average loss per secondary pupil Gloucestershire's average spend per pupil has dropped ten places from 102 to 112. Every secondary school under the new school funding scheme, with Marling and Thomas Keble losing the maximum possible and Katherine Lady Berkeley just under behind. With school buildings especially needing a significant investment, now is the worst time to be cutting educational spending. It is a crisis, and it is only going to get worse under the Tories. From children's centres, through academy chains to universities, our education system is steadily being privatised and downgraded. Labour will take the profit motive out of education and do the right thing for our children.
